summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting T-Mobile USA, Inc. to provide records related to a criminal investigation. The subpoena outlines the required records and emphasizes the need for confidentiality regarding the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who issued the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Alison G. Moe
persons.context: Alison G. Moe is an Assistant United States Attorney who is mentioned in connection with the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: Amanda Young is a Special Agent with the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force, referenced for receiving the requested records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to T-Mobile USA, Inc. for records related to a criminal investigation.

events.title: Appearance Date for Grand Jury
events.description: T-Mobile USA, Inc. is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and provide evidence regarding the investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The grand jury subpoena was issued on June 10, 2019.
T-Mobile USA, Inc. is requested to provide records from January 1, 2002, through December 31, 2006.
The subpoena requests various types of records including call details, subscriber information, and SMS/text messaging records.
Amanda Young is the designated Special Agent for receiving the records requested in the subpoena.
The document emphasizes the importance of confidentiality regarding the investigation.
